poem:
Title: "In Betwixt Power and Foolish Wagers"

Within wallpapered halls, game of power unfurls,
Vexed Cameron cries, Sunak's man in swirls.
Bold bet of July's ballot, a coin on life unfurls,
Craig's cuffs greased, by hundred pound pearls.
Oh, Williams of Montgomeryshire, shadowed in allegation,
Beckoning fortune in Ladbrokes' temptation.
These suited jesters, their frail kingdom's foundation,
Drown in folly's sea, their common affliction.
